id.description: The unique ID for the post

type.description: The post type used to represent the true intention of the post

peer.description: The author peer of the post, this property can be null if the post was deleted.

source.description: The source for where this post was composed from or collected from (eg; the client the user is using or the third-party source that the post was collected. This is determined by the server). This property can be null if the post was deleted.

text.description: The text content of the post source. This property can be null if the post has been deleted

entities.description: An array of entities extracted from the text, can be used by the client to highlight clickable entities that preforms an action. This property can be null if the post was deleted.

mentioned_peers.description: An array of resolved peers that was mentioned in the post text. This property can be null if the post was deleted

reply_to_post.description: The original post that this post is replying to if applicable, otherwise null.

quoted_post.description: The original post that this post is quoting if applicable, otherwise null

reposted_post.description: The original post that this post is reposting if applicable, otherwise null

likes_count.description: The amount of likes that this post has if applicable, otherwise null

reposts_count.description: The amount of repost that this post has if applicable, otherwise null

quotes_count.description: The amount of replies that this post has if applicable, otherwise null

posted_timestamp.description: The Unix Timestamp for when this post was created

flags.description: The flags associated with this post (WIP)

network_name.description: The name of the network, eg; "Socialvoid"

protocol_version.description: The version of the protocol standard that the server is using, eg; "1.0"

cdn_server.description: The HTTP URL Endpoint for the CDN server of the network

upload_max_file_size.description: The maximum size of a file that you can upload to the CDN Server (in bytes)

unauthorized_session_ttl.description: The maximum time-to-live (in seconds) that an unauthorized session may have. The server will often reset the expiration whenever the session is used.

authorized_session_ttl.description: The maximum time-to-live (in seconds) that an authorized session may have. The server will often reset the expiration whenever the session is used.

retrieve_likes_max_limit.description: The maximum amount of likes a client can retrieve at once using the method `timeline.get_likes` via the `limit` parameter

retrieve_reposts_max_limit.description: The maximum amount of reposts a client can retrieve at once using the method `timeline.get_reposted_peers` via the `limit` parameter

retrieve_replies_max_limit.description: The maximum amount of replies a client can retrieve at once using the method `timeline.get_replies` via the `limit` parameter

retrieve_quotes_max_limit.description: The maximum amount of quotes a client can retrieve at once using the method `timeline.get_quotes` via the `limit` parameter

retrieve_followers_max_limit.description: The maximum amount of followers a client can retrieve at once using the method `network.get_followers` via the `limit` parameter

retrieve_following_max_limit.description: The maximum amount of following peers a client can retrieve at once using the method `network.get_following` via the `limit` parameter

id.description: The ID of the user associated to the network

type.description: The type of the peer entity

name.description: The display name of the peer

username.description: The username associated with this peer

id.description: The ID of the session obtained when establishing a session

flags.description: An array of flags that has been set to this session

authenticated.description: Indicates if the session is currently authenticated to a user

created.description: The Unix Timestamp for when this session was first created

expires.description: The Unix Timestamp for when this session expires

file_name.description: The original name of the file

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes

file_type.description: The type of file detected by the server

flags.description: An array of flags associated with this document

id.description: The ID of the document, if the document gets updated then the ID will change.

text.description: The text contents of the document

entities.description: An array of text entities being represented in the text

document.description: The document object that points to the display picture

first_name.description: The first name of the entity

last_name.description: The last name of the entity

name.description: The full display name of the entity

biography.description: A biography or description of the entity

url.description: The URL of the entity (Can be a website or a blog, etc)

followers_count.description: The amount of followers that this entity has

following_count.description: The amount of peers that this entity is following

display_picture_sizes.description: An array of display picture size objects that represents the entity's display picture

session_id.description: The ID of the session obtained when establishing a session

client_public_hash.description: The Public Hash of the client used when establishing the session

challenge_answer.description: The session challenge answer revolving around the client's private hash, the same client used to establish the session

id.description: The ID of the session obtained when establishing a session

offset.description: The offset for when the entity begins in the text

value.description: The value of the entity, for styling entities such as `BOLD | ITALIC`, etc. this value will be null, but for values such as `MENTION | HASHTAG` & `URL` the value will contain the respective value for the entity, for example a `URL` entity will contain a value of a http URL
